page.title: 11Sutton Manor Colliery.
page.content: Sutton Manor is the local colliery found towards the eastern border of the block. Relatively few coal-mining families are found in the Rainhill area, however. The following account comes from the son of a coal miner. About 950 people work at Sutton Manor and it produces about 657,000 tonnes of coal a year. About Â£17 millions will be invested in the pit over the next few years. The method by which coal is raised is being modernised, the existing cage with two decks, each holding two trucks, is being replaced by one cage with a large skip. This will eliminate the problem of coal being stored at the pit bottom because it cannot be raised quickly enough. Winches, which are now steam driven, are being replaced by electric winders.
